title: Can support Carry?
body:
So obviously i cant carry as support by the means  of getting fed
I'm in bronze and i feel i may have been "carrying" in the way that i have been helping the adc or mid get fed.
Peeling fgor them setting up the kills and so on

Then i find in bronze the biggest issue is they do not know when an objective is a good idea, Or what objective is good

so for example...
we killed 3 or 4 of them and they all started splitting up.. I pinged the hell out of mid saying Push mid hard
We pushed mid and got the inhib

then i noticed top and bot pushing.. i pinged 2 to top and 3 bot
the response was what about mid?
I replied " if they defend us they dont defend mid, and mid will push into base
if they decide to hold mid and defend us then they will be weak
We then all grouped and just pushed bot instead they tried to hold mid and bot.. we killed at bot and then the mid guys decided to come try a 2 v 5
We killed them and took inhib.. 4 dead now.. then my team started saying Baren baren baren..
I pinged no!! end game 4 dead 5 of us go go go!
We went in killed last guy took tower, they started to spawn, 3 got the respawns 2 got tower and then All went for nexus

ow im not sure if this is classified as a carry but commanding the team as a support felt great and exhausting al at once. 


thats my story.. 3 wins in a row doing this.. most wins in a row ive had in a long time :)

replies.body: Sona is very deadly if build right

Yes, it is actually quite common to hard carry with Supports (ie Lux + Mejais). As for roaming mid and directing your team, this isn't carrying - it's just playing the role properly :) In the Juggernaut meta it is possible to hard carry with tanks too, like Tahm or Trundle.
Yes all the time, its how I climbed from bronze to gold.

Nice work in your game! Communication is key for a support, and you're dead right in saying that you can carry a game from just commanding a team!

As a support you don't have the ability to *hard carry* a game in regards to damage output, and you also do not have to typically focus on a lot of the mechanical aspects such as csing/kiting etc. This allows you more time to observe the state of the game and communicate it to your team. Keep watching the minimap and pinging out objectives in advance. Time all of the summoners and ultimates you can see within a fight and make sure to remind your team of it. 

Your understanding of objectives within the game was perfect, and I can see it being a good strength for you to go into shotcalling with. A skill which is very good to have at all levels of play! As a support you also will need to adapt your play style between roaming to snowball other lanes, or protecting your carry to win the lane yourself. Support's kits hold a lot of potential for great roaming if you have CC, or alternatively if you don't, getting deep vision and then using your shotcalling to make a play which can win the game.

Support is a great role to master, but don't expect people to listen or praise you all the time for your good work. Quite often what you do will be go unnoticed, but that happens. You will have people ignore your calls on occasion (even if they were great!) and you will have bad teammates which makes it feel like you can't carry. But just remember as long as you play CONSISTENTLY well and keep communicating as much of the game as you can analyze, it will always help your team win. You CAN carry from support, and its great to see you feeling so good after the last game.

Keep it up!

I remember, my promos to Silver, (the first time I went from Bronze to Silver because I've done it a loooooooooooooooot). I've never carried any games so hard in my life, like, seriously, EVER. I remember, I won the first one by carrying with kills and the next two, with shotcalling and I was the ONLY one making calls and for some reason, everyone just, listened. I know how exhausting it can be, believe me, but it is definitely one of the best ways to carry as a support. Just keep at it!

Carrying from support requires at least one competent carry on your team, preferably the ADC. Play a champ with lots of peel but still good at locking down opponents and dealing damage. Leona is good because she can engage really well with her blade, or just use her stun to peel. Her ult is really versatile too and getting good at those will force a few flashes in the least. Braum is good too because he can "protect the carry" so to speak. In earlier elos Lux is good I heard (not even bronze here) because she has solid CC in Q and a good zoning tool with E. She can also secure kills with her ult and she has a shield but don't rely on it too much.

Basically, peel and CC is a priority. Tankyness is good too.
people dont seem to know her stun hits 2 enemies, they hide behind a minion alot so i just go.. uhh ok.. stun
Supports can carry to a degree, most of the time you need a duo partner to climb, it will take twice as many games to climb as support then any other role, as you have to rely on 3-4 other players

> as you have to rely on 3-4 other players

exactly this. You can enable your team mates to carry, but if they suck then no amount of supporting will win the game.

Heavily reliant on skill of team.
Play, Braum or nami or Morg, hardest cc/peel in game.

I'm a support main and have been silver for 3-4 years running, all i can say is supports can not carry, BUT you should start teamfights and when you are in one the most important bit is to peel for your adc (or whoever is carrying) if you keep your mind clear and just peeling for your adc, you will win teamfights much more. Also remember to build for your team's needs, such as, sight stone, locket and so on. 
I recommend playing Lulu, Leona, Janna they are very usefully and if played right will win you a lot of games.
Good Luck.
P.S. I got B4 for my placements and now i'm S2 just by playing support :3
Supports can't carry because generally my team in bronze elo goes 0/6 by 8 minutes, then I give up.

Shot answer: No.

Long answer: Yes.

Typically no a support can't outright carry, more often than not if a support tries to go out of their way to do the most damage or get kills they hurt the team more than they help, so they can't traditionally carry.
Sure you can go Brand "support" build full AP and it might /work/ in Bronze.

However Supports can carry in their own way, by building to the match, getting their team mates out of trouble, or lining up kills through CC or some form of utility.
There are many different supports ranging from Poke/Utility supports like Sona {{champion:37}} or Soraka {{champion:16}} to Tank/Lockdown supports like Thresh {{champion:412}} Nautilus {{champion:111}} or Leona {{champion:89}} to hybrid style supports like Poke/Lockdown play style of Karma {{champion:43}} or Tank/Utility of Taric {{champion:44}} .

Every player has a play style they excel at, there are champs you can "carry" with from that play style.
But it's also important to remember champion match ups.

LoL is heavily based on champions countering champions.
Such as Morgana counters Thresh/Leona, but the poke of Sona/Karma counters Morgana.
Not to mention that certain carries work better or worse with certain supports.
